content.statement: dial-001-overview is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding dial-001-overview helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of dial-001-overview include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of dial-001-overview.

avg.description: Prosthetic graft (PTFE) connecting artery to vein

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

preoperative_planning.referral_timing: When GFR <30 or expected dialysis within 6-12 months
preoperative_planning.vein_preservation: Avoid venipuncture and IV placement in non-dominant arm
preoperative_planning.vein_mapping: Duplex ultrasound to assess vein diameter (>2.5mm), depth, continuity

site_selection.order_preference: Non-dominant arm first; most distal site first
site_selection.radiocephalic: Wrist-level, preserves proximal sites, lowest flow (less steal)
site_selection.brachiocephalic: Antecubital, higher success rate, higher flow
site_selection.brachiobasilic: Requires transposition (basilic vein deep), good secondary option
site_selection.leg: Thigh AVF/AVG - when upper extremity exhausted

maturation.timeline: 6-12 weeks for AVF; 2-3 weeks for AVG
maturation.failure_to_mature: Evaluated at 4-6 weeks; fistulogram, intervention if needed

definition.@value: Surgical creation of vascular access for hemodialysis, preferentially native arteriovenous fistula

clinical_pearls: Fistula First: AVF has lowest infection, best patency, lowest mortality
Plan access when GFR <30 - AVF needs 6-12 weeks to mature
Protect veins early - no IVs or blood draws in non-dominant arm in CKD patients
Rule of 6s: mature fistula = 6mm diameter, <6mm depth, >600mL/min flow, 6cm length

medicalCode.description: Arteriovenous anastomosis, direct, forearm vein transposition
Bypass left radial artery to left cephalic vein with autologous tissue substitute, open approach

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
